content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) The work shown is Empirical Construction, Istanbul, created in 2003 C.E. by Julie Mehretu. Describe at least two visual characteristics of the work. Using specific visual evidence, explain at least two ways in which the artist used these visual elements to portray a contemporary urban environment. Explain how Mehretu’s presentation of a contemporary urban environment exemplifies at least one central theme of contemporary art.

topic.text: 10.1: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Global Contemporary Art

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Describe visual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. form.  b. style.  c. materials.  d. technique.  e. content.
